definition: to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
do not/there is none who
surname Mo
to touch
to feel about/to grope about/to fumble/to do things slowly
to have a clear view (of a situation)/to fish for information/fact-finding
to suss out/to figure out/to ascertain
to gently caress and stroke/to pet/to fondle
to go through challenging experiences/to become seasoned (in one's profession etc)
lit. to follow the vine to get to the melon/to track sth following clues
surreptitious/sneaky
surreptitious/sneaky
to be unable to make any sense of the matter/to be at a loss
to grope about in the dark
to wade across the river, feeling for footholds as one goes (idiom)/to advance cautiously, step by step/to feel one's way forward
pinyin: mo1 zhe5 shi2 tou5 guo4 he2

definition: to fathom/to make sense of/to grasp
can't touch/can't reach/(fig.) unable to get a grasp of

sentences.english: I felt a touch on my arm.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得手臂上有人摸了一下。

sentences.english: On entering the courtyard, I touched the pawn ticket again.
sentences.chinese: 又摸一摸當票才走進院去。

sentences.english: Draw two cards for yourself. You may use it when is your Action Phase.
sentences.chinese: 出牌階段，對你自己使用，摸兩張牌。

sentences.english: I can't feel anything through these gloves.
sentences.chinese: 我戴著手套什麼都摸不出來。

sentences.english: "That's right, " says the doctor. He then begins to fondle her breasts.
sentences.chinese: “對”大夫說，然後開始摸她的咪咪。

sentences.english: Yes. I like the picture of horse.
She groped for her key in her bag.
My mouse cursor is over here on the top right, now, I touch the cat.
sentences.chinese: 我們鼠標移到右上方時，我們摸了下貓。

sentences.english: Touching something soft, I sprang quickly back.
sentences.chinese: 摸到一種軟呼呼的東西，我一下子蹦了回來。

sentences.english: Did it again tonight too, " Blindy said happily."
sentences.chinese: “今晚俺又摸了一次，”盲漢得意地說。

sentences.english: Feel the little finger edge of your hand.
sentences.chinese: 摸一下你手掌的小指一側。

sentences.english: One woman adjusted Sandys pillow and stroked her hair.
sentences.chinese: 一個婦女調整了桑迪的枕頭，摸着她的頭髮。

sentences.english: For he had healed many; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him, as many as had plagues.
sentences.chinese: 他治好了許多人，所以凡有災病的，都擠進來要摸他。

sentences.english: Dark bar for himself to touch all four pieces of the same brand.
sentences.chinese: 暗槓則爲自己摸到全部四張同樣的牌。

sentences.english: He quickly opens the door and fumbles an arm and pulls it hard.
sentences.chinese: 他趕緊打開車門，摸到一隻手臂，使勁拽。
